column1: # * Not the same form of division as IDIV; rounding is toward negative infinity.

column2: r/m8 can not be encoded to access the following byte registers if a REX prefix is used: AH

column1: # *** The 8086 does not mask the shift count. However
column2: all other IA-32 processors (starting with the Intel 286 processor)

column1: # do mask the shift count to 5 bits
column2: resulting in a maximum count of 31. This masking is done in all operating modes

column1: # (including the virtual-8086 mode) to reduce the maximum execution time of the instructions.
